name: Pope Pius II
summary: Pius II, born Enea Silvio Bartolomeo Piccolomini, was Pope from 1458 to 1464. He was a renowned humanist, author, and poet before becoming pope. He is best known for his autobiography, 'Commentaries,' which provides valuable insights into Renaissance papal culture. He tried to organize a crusade against the Ottoman Turks after the fall of Constantinople but was unsuccessful. He was a patron of the arts and learning, embodying the Renaissance papacy. He renamed himself Pius (Pious) after the Roman poet Virgil's character Aeneas.
